poem:
Title: "In the Faces of Shadows"

In the heart of the foggy Tyne, hides a man,
Both tormentor and tormented, steeped in his own regret.
With scars, a map of sorrow etched on his face,
A game of hide and seek with remorse and despair.
Speak, oh fractured city, of the trail left by tears,
And hope in tomorrow's dawn, these paths may intersect.
